Job Description
Position:EMEA Business Process Analyst My WorkspaceJob Description:
Arrow Enterprise Computing Solutions, a division of the Arrow Electronics Group (16,500 employees spread across 58 countries, turnover + $29 billion), provides IT professionals (service companies, publishers and integrators) with global technological solutions associated with offers of training and services, in 5 main segments: servers, storage and virtualization, networks and security, infrastructure software and Cloud solutions.

As part of its growth, ARROW BSC is strengthening its teams and is looking for a EMEA Business Process analyst My workspace

What you will be doing at ARROW:

An Arrow BPM is a strategic leader responsible for optimizing an organization’s operations on a dedicated set of assignments. He/she identifies bottlenecks, streamline workflows, and drives growth by translating complex business needs into efficient processes.
He/she meticulously examines existing processes to identify inefficiencies and opportunities for improvement. He/she creates detailed process maps and redesign workflows to enhance performance and achieve desired outcomes.
Successfully implementing process changes requires adept leadership. BPM oversees organizational change initiatives, helps to develop communication plans, provide guidance for training, and support the Change management team to address resistance to ensure smooth transitions.
He/she establishes key performance indicators (KPIs) and track process metrics to gauge the effectiveness of process improvements. BPM collects and analyzes data to identify trends, measure progress, and make data-driven decisions.
PBM works closely with various departments to gather input from stakeholders and defines standardized metrics. This collaboration ensures that process improvements align with overall business goals.
Who are we looking for?

Good mixture between technical & soft skills is required:
Process Mapping and Modeling: Proficiency in tools like BPMN (Business Process Model and Notation), Microsoft Visio to visualize and design efficient processes.
Data Analysis: Ability to analyze data using tools like Power BI, or Excel to identify trends and measure process performance.
Lean and Six Sigma: Knowledge of Lean management and Six Sigma methodologies to reduce waste and improve process efficiency.
Configure Price Quote (CPQ) & Salesforce applications knowledge.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey process changes and collaborate with stakeholders in fluent English.
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to identify issues and develop innovative solutions.
Leadership: Ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage change initiatives.
Organizational Skills: Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects and ensure timely completion.
Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing business environments and requirements.
Collaboration: Ability to work collaboratively with various departments to gather input and ensure process improvements align with business goals.
What is in it for you?

Full Permanent contract,
Social advantage: CNSS, CIMR, Health insurance,
Very good working atmosphere in a team of passionate collaborators,
Work culture where you can make an impact,
Working within an international organization, recognized worldwide in its sector

Job Description
Supply Chain Analyst (Production Planner)


At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world.


Job Overview


TE Connectivity's Supply Chain Managers are responsible for the timely, cost-effective procurement, inventory control, planning and quality control of production materials. They ensure the availability of materials in the supply chain, as scheduled, and the maintenance of inventory at the established levels. They coordinate and integrate the flow of materials and information among suppliers, manufacturers, distributors and customers, identifying opportunities for improving efficiency, effectiveness and capabilities of the supply chain. Resources are focused on continuous improvement of the movement of materials through production processes, and the establishment of key performance metrics and benchmarks to monitor actual performance against goals.
Your main tasks


• Responsible for Material planning, scheduling and inventory control by using SAP.
• Collaborating with Plants Supply Chain and production teams to address component availability, production-related, and purchasing issues.
• Planning NPI project production in alignment with customer demand and validation requirements.
• Place production orders based on the project needs, if needed, manually adjust the production BOM in accordance with PDS (Product Development Sheet).
• Launch purchase orders and maintain close alignment with suppliers on topics related to material procurement.
• Onboarding new suppliers by managing individual orders and scheduling agreements according to project demands.
• Maintain appropriate material master data in SAP (MRP Views).
• Analyzing potential Supply Chain blockages, focusing on medium- and short-term internal production and supplier capacities.
• Developing Supply Chain mapping for new projects.
• Advises on availability date of finished products to Customer Service teams.
• Highlight BOM / Routing errors when encountered and follow up until resolved with Manufacturing Engineering
• Work with Quality to ensure timely release of finished goods & WIPs, coordinating and scheduling reworks as necessary
Your ideal background


• Master’s degree.
• Minimum 3 years of work experience in Production planning.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Self-organized, structured/methodical, take initiative.
• Strong customer focus.
• Excellent communication skills in English.
• Excellent SAP knowledge required

Job Description

AbbVie’s Gastrointestinal (GI)/Immunology Discovery Research group is looking for a highly motivated and experienced in vivo and in vitro cell biologist to play an integral role in advancing therapeutics to treat inflammatory GI disorders. This position offers an exciting opportunity to advance the understanding of mucosal immune responses and discover novel therapies for Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD).

The ideal candidate would work within the highly matrixed and collaborative GI Discovery team to identify key gaps for programs in AbbVie’s GI portfolio. The candidate is expected to design, execute, interpret and present innovative research to advance programs towards the clinic. We are seeking a hands-on experimentalist who is proficient with in vivo and in vitro cell biology research and has demonstrated scientific leadership with internal and external stake holders/experts. The expectation is that the candidate would dedicate the majority of their time toward wet lab experimentation, data analysis and presentation. In addition, we are seeking a candidate, with excellent written and oral communication skills, who environment has exemplified their scientific acumen through first author publication of peer reviewed research. The candidate will have the opportunity to present their results at team and internal/external science meetings. Prior experience in IBD, humanized mouse models, or transcriptomics analysis are preferred. 

Major Responsibilities:

Identify critical biology questions in line with department/project strategy, and address them with experimental design and execution
Highly autonomous and productive in performing laboratory research and method development, requiring only minimal direction from supervisor.
Formulate conclusions and design follow-on experiments based on multidisciplinary data.
Primary author of publications, presentations, regulatory documents and/or primary inventor of patents.
Understand and adhere to corporate standards regarding code of conduct, safety, appropriate handling of materials, controlled drug and radioactive compounds, and animal care

Qualifications

Qualifications: 

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent education and typically 10+ years experience, Master's Degree or equivalent education and typically 8+ years experience, or PhD and typically 0-3 years of experience. 
Possess thorough theoretical and practical understanding of own scientific discipline, especially within gastrointestinal physiology and inflammation.
Highly proficient with in vivo techniques such as mouse restraint, PO and IP dosing routes, and rodent necropsy. Experience with some colitis models is preferred.
Highly proficient in primary cell culture, including isolation of human and rodent cells, with  inflammatory stimulation.
Technical capabilities including RT-qPCR, Western blot, multi-color flow cytometry and use of BioTuring or Ingenuity Pathway Analysis.
Demonstrated ability to learn, understand and master new experimental techniques.
Demonstrated scientific writing skills and strong verbal communication skills through publication and conference presentations.

At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world.
Job Overview


TE Connectivity's Manufacturing and Process Development Engineering Teams significantly impact LEANPD driven new product development projects, driving for excellence in existing manufacturing technologies and methods and striving to implement new manufacturing technologies to provide improved process and tolerance control. They act as the binding element between product development and manufacturing engineering, ensuring the effectiveness and efficiency of this critical interface. They support Product Development in the optimization of designs and piece parts for manufacturability by realizing sample tooling/products/prototypes. They also design, develop, and qualify tooling and processes to meet TE quality and production standards, document all processes and tooling in applicable TE systems, support supply chain to verify supplier compliance and capability, initiate and implement programs to continuously improve quality, cost and cycle time and adhere to all appropriate specifications, regulatory requirements and customer requirements.
Your main tasks


• Provides responsive support to the assembly production line to ensure the safe manufacture of quality products to meet on time delivery schedule,

• Works with the Production and EHS department to implement any necessary safety controls and measures,
• Lead the correct implementation of the engineering change initiated by the product engineering team or due to a row material shortage.
• Ensures product documentation (product specification, packaging instructions, local standards,...) and manufacturing processes meet all TE Quality system requirements
• Ensures that processes are documented in a clear and understandable way.

Engineer degree in mechanical or electromechanical or automation engineering
1-3 years Experience.
Good level in programming of PLC
High precision cameras programming and set up
Sensors set up and adjustment
Proficiency with programming languages.
Learning concepts and applying them to other problems
Problem-solving capability.

Job Description
ROLE SUMMARY

The MSL, as a customer facing colleague, will have 90% of their time in the Field covering all Moroccan territory.
Serve as a conduit and resource for Medical Information and customer insights, providing requested information to Health Care professionals (HCPs) as allowed by Pfizer guidance and sharing customer viewpoints with Pfizer as appropriate.
Maintain required level of knowledge of relevant Therapeutic Area (TA)/disease states and Pfizer medicines, providing therapeutic area/product information to both internal and external stakeholders as needed
Execute Medical strategy and engagement for appropriate assigned customers compliantly coordinating with other Pfizer colleagues as needed to achieve Medical objectives
Deliver approved medical content about Pfizer medicines and relevant topics in the designated therapeutic area focusing on the relevant stakeholders and customers.
ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES

Understand the priorities of Pfizer Medical Affairs in the respective TA in order to contribute to execute aligned Field Medical tactics
Provide education on the clinical impact of Pfizer medicines to help inform customer decision-making and improve patient outcome through the communication of real-world data analyses, and medical presentations.
Provide objective and scientifically sound medical information regarding Pfizer’s medicines and the diseases they prevent through educational programs and scientific collaboration.
Identify and seek medical engagement from the assigned customers
Share internally the insights from the customers, and identify opportunities for collaboration to improve patient care
Execute mutually beneficial customer-specific projects, collaborations, strategic medical partnerships, and non-interventional studies with the goal of advancing quality of care and improving patient outcomes
Maintain significant market and customer knowledge in an increasingly complex and dynamic marketplace
Manage a significant volume of projects developed in a field-based environment, while exhibiting the ability to prioritize, successfully implement, and demonstrate excellent judgment skills.
Demonstrate expertise in communication across multiple channels, including, but not limited to, live and virtual presentations in small or large settings, written communication or virtual conversations
Optimize patient centricity of Medical communications and deliverables, to ensure that patients remain the ultimate focus
Appropriately provide Medical support throughout the Investigator Sponsored Research (ISR) process
Cultivate research and therapeutic area expertise, including familiarity with latest congress data and disease state literature
To develop and maintain ongoing cross-functional working relationships with Pfizer colleagues within the in-country, above-country and global organization
REQUIREMENTS

University degree in Medicine or Pharmacy
1-3 years experience in pharmaceutical Industry (Medical, commercial.)
Prior experience in a respective Therapeutic Area is preferred
Awareness of pharmaceutical industry codes, policies, local regulations.
Possess strong analytical, self-awareness, and interpersonal skills
Demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills: ability to manage and handle conflict constructively
Strong comprehension and communication skills, including ability to communicate large amounts of scientific information in a manner that is clear and concise
Demonstrate a strong patient-centric, customer-focused approach with the utmost medical professionalism
Demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills
Demonstrate the ability to Work within a matrixed, multi-disciplinary team
Well-organized with the ability to be flexible, prioritize multiple demands.
Rapidly adopt and utilize new digital technology and other resources with medical customers and record medical interactions
Effectively manage through and be part of the change in an ever-changing and evolving external health care environment
 
Work Location Assignment: On Premise

Team
VOICE is the department, within SERVICES division, which is responsible for building “cost and quality effective” networks for UCC and Wholesale services (Voice, Video, Conferencing, Contact Center,VoLTE,…), and connecting them with other major telecommunication companies. These networks are built to manage effectively our customer’s communications and collaboration from and to our network. We are a very “hybrid” team, with a very unique mixture of technical, business and financial responsibilities.


B&A¿(Business & Analytics) team (part of Voice department) is specifically focused on ¿addressing cost control business and analytics, with digitalization and automation in Voice activities (capacity management, forecasting, budgeting & cost management, profitability calculations,¿ operational trend analysis … )
Our team is working in an AGILE environment driven by empowerment, autonomy, experimentation, transparency, cooperation, adaptation, flexibility. Our team has talent and skills, youthfulness vs. experience, technical vs. business, operational vs. design, legacy vs. new technology, and routine vs. new challenges.


Mission
As Team Manager of Business and Analytics team, your mission is to coach, help, support, lead the team members in the activities in the UCC and Wholesale services domain (Voice, Video, Conferencing, Contact Center, VoLTE,…), related to digitalization and automation of business control area, focusing on cost savings projects,¿ third party vendors¿cost, traffic routing & analysis, Quality Of Experience analysis, Network Capacity management. All activities performed within¿a fully Agile environment.

As¿B&A Team Manager your key tasks and activities will be:
Coaching and Supporting the team for the Digital Transformation by supporting Automation of activities especially in the areas of Big Data management, Business Intelligence, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science

Supporting the team on Designing the Voice Services for Cost and QoS optimization
Driving Network Service Optimization processes and associated implementations, in Agile

Education, qualification and certifications Language skills: PC & SW Skills: ¿¿¿¿¿¿¿¿¿ Strong computer literacy & ¿proficiency in MS Word, MS Excel and MS Powerpoint ¿¿¿¿¿¿¿¿¿ Basic scripting / data manipulation / BI skills are desirable ¿¿¿¿¿¿¿¿ Experience in software development in Agile as well as traditional methods and practices and the ability to blend them together ¿¿¿¿¿¿¿ Experience in implementing software or web development projects using Agile methodologies, and experience in large, complex projects in a high-tech development environment with multi-function teams. ¿¿¿¿¿¿¿¿Experience with Safe, SCRUM/Agile methodologies with enterprise-level application development projects. PMI-ACP, CSM, or equivalent welcome. ¿¿¿¿¿¿¿¿Experience in Big Data is preferable ( eg Python, Scala, Adoop …) and API management A working experience in an international / multicultural environment is desirable Essential skills and knowledge - Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills with an ability to manage competing demands - Ability to be flexible while working in a changing environment - Excellent oral and written communications skills and experience interacting with both business and IT individuals at all levels including the executive level - Creative approach to problem-solving with the ability to focus on details while maintaining the “big picture” view Global opportunities: Work in multi-national teams with the opportunity to collaborate with colleagues and customers from all over the world Flexible work environment: Flexible working hours and possibility to combine work from office and home (hybrid ways of working) Professional development: training programs and upskilling/re-skilling opportunities Career growth: Internal growth and mobility opportunities within Orange Caring and daring culture: health and well-being programs and benefits, diversity & inclusion initiatives, CSR and employee connect events Reward programs: Employee Referral Program, Change Maker Awards

Develop and implement strategies to drive sales and maximize revenue within the category.
Collaborate with the sales and marketing teams to create and execute promotional campaigns and initiatives tailored to the category.
Analyze sales data and market trends to identify opportunities for growth and improvement.
Monitor and report on key account metrics, including sales performance, inventory levels, and customer satisfaction.
Negotiate and finalize agreements with key accounts, ensuring mutual benefit and sustainable partnerships.
Provide exceptional customer service and support to key clients, addressing any issues or concerns in a timely and effective manner.
Stay updated on industry trends, competitor activities, and consumer preferences within the category.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including merchandising, operations, and logistics, to ensure seamless account management and fulfillment.
What we are looking for

A minimum of 3 years experience in the Beauty & Personal Care industry in Morocco
Perfect knowledge & understanding of the Beauty & Personal Care industry actors & dynamics in Morocco
Top Engineering, Business Schools & Universities (top 5 of your field for your country)
Proficiency in MS Office and google tools
Familiar with relationship management tools
Strong commercial & analytical skills
Great capacity to handle high stake negotiations
Good with tools (MS Office and google tools)
Strong inter-personal skills: Convince the people and your team that you are making the right decisions
Great ability to work in a fast paced and competitive environment
Flawless English and French communication.
 A successful candidate will fulfil the following requirements:

A unique opportunity of having strong impact in building the African e-commerce sector
The opportunity to become part of a highly professional and dynamic team
An unparalleled personal and professional growth as our longer-term objective is to train the next generation of leaders.
We Offer:

A unique experience in an entrepreneurial, yet structured environment
A unique opportunity of having strong impact in building the African e-commerce sector
The opportunity to become part of a highly professional and dynamic team
An unparalleled personal and professional growth as our longer-term objective is to train the next generation of leaders

Description du poste
Nous cherchons à renforcer nos équipes d’audit françaises en recrutant une équipe d’audit localisée à Casablanca.

Être auditeur chez Forvis Mazars, c’est une expérience unique et riche ! 

Notre état d’esprit ? Déployer une approche sur-mesure et innovante pour nos clients, et ce dans la bonne humeur ! 

Nos enjeux ? Comprendre les problématiques de nos clients et les intégrer dans un contexte de révolution digitale, d’intelligence artificielle et de profondes mutations qui impactent les fonctions financières et le métier d’auditeur. 

Chez Forvis Mazars, la transformation digitale a offert de nouvelles perspectives : réinventer l'Audit, métier historique de Forvis Mazars. L'équipe ISAA (Information System Audit & Analytics) a développé une approche qui intègre l'Audit du contrôle interne et des Systèmes d'Information. 

L'équipe comprend des experts sectoriels (banque, assurance, industrie, secteur public, services …), des personnes certifiées en termes de contrôle interne, gestion des risques IT et sur certaines technologies de marché (SAP, Oracle Applications, PowerBI, etc.). 

En tant que jeune auditeur vous intégrerez l’équipe ISAA (Information System Audit & Analytics) composée de collaborateurs qui conjuguent des expertises variées (gouvernance IT, data, ERP, finance, …) pour servir les missions d’audit et de conseil. 

Vous aurez l’opportunité d’acquérir rapidement une méthodologie d’audit orientée systèmes d’information qui vous offrira un rôle clé dans la mission d’audit de commissariat aux comptes. 

La diversité de nos clients et de nos missions vous fera participer à des problématiques à enjeux : 

Analyse de l’environnement et de la stratégie d’entreprise sur le volet système d’information
Revue du contrôle interne IT et évaluation des risques
Audit des états financiers sous l’angle informatique
Revue de migration de systèmes vers des grands ERP
Revue de processus Métier et IT
Outre votre participation à la certification des comptes, vous interviendrez également sur des missions d’audit contractuel et de revue de projets et de projets SOCR (Service Organizations Control Reporting) / audit selon la norme ISAE3402 ! 

L’équipe Audit & Analytics place l’innovation au cœur de sa stratégie et développe des approches Data Analytics et Process Mining. Ainsi, vous pourrez travailler sur des technologies de DataPrep ou de DataViz telles qu’Alteryx ou PowerBI. ou encore participer au développement de solutions Mazars. 

Le rôle de l’Auditeur implique un engagement et un devoir de confidentialité quant à la diffusion et au partage des informations manipulées en externe et en interne. 


Qualifications
Diplômé(e) d’un niveau bac+5 d’une grande école de commerce, d’ingénieurs ou d’université, vous souhaitez saisir l’opportunité de participer à un parcours d’envergure. Intéressé(e) par l’idée de devenir un auditeur « tout-terrain », vous êtes curieux(se), flexible et vous faites preuve d’une forte autonomie et de rigueur. Outre un sens aigu des relations humaines qui vous permettra d’être à l’écoute de nos clients et d’intégrer nos équipes, vous possédez des compétences dans l’audit et/ou les systèmes d’information. 

Et parce qu’elle contribue à matérialiser l’excellence de Forvis Mazars à la française, votre expression orale est aisée et votre expression écrite évidemment impeccable. 

Enfin, votre anglais et votre français vous permettent d’interagir à l’écrit comme l’oral avec les clients dans un contexte international. 

Si vous êtes passionné(e) par les données et souhaitez évoluer dans un environnement stimulant, n'hésitez pas à nous envoyer votre candidature !

Processus de recrutement

Charline Courty a la charge de ce recrutement, elle sera votre point de contact tout au long du processus. Une fois votre candidature envoyée, vous recevrez une réponse dans un délai de quelques jours à 4 semaines maximum. Si votre candidature est retenue, vous serez contacté(e) pour passer 3 entretiens d’1h chacun répartis de manière suivante :

- 1 entretien sur votre Parcours Académique + une étude de cas

- 1 entretien RH avec Charline, Recruteuse 

- 1 entretien Parcours Professionnel

Date de publication : 07-06-2024
Nous gérons chez Trusted Advisors notre marque employeur ainsi que notre processus de recrutement par le biais de notre (le « Site Carrière »), ainsi qu’avec l’aide d’un système de suivi des candidats.
Dans la présente Politique de confidentialité, nous expliquons comment nous traitons vos données à caractère personnel dans les cas suivants :
La présente Politique de confidentialité décrit également les droits dont vous disposez lorsque nous traitons vos données à caractère personnel, ainsi que la manière dont vous pouvez exercer ces droits.
Lorsque nous utilisons le terme « Candidat » dans la présente Politique de confidentialité, nous faisons référence à chacun des Candidats connectés, Candidats postulants, Candidats sourcés et Candidats coopté, sauf indication contraire.
1. À propos du traitement des données à caractère personnel


Les données à caractère personnel désignent toutes les informations qui peuvent être directement ou indirectement liées à une personne physique vivante. Voici quelques exemples de données à caractère personnel : nom, adresse e-mail, numéro de téléphone et adresse IP. Par traitement de données à caractère personnel, il faut entendre toute utilisation automatisée de données à caractère personnel - telles que la collecte, la création, l'analyse, le partage et la suppression de données à caractère personnel.
Des lois et des réglementations régissent la manière dont les entreprises peuvent traiter les données à caractère personnel, appelées lois sur la protection des données. Différentes lois sur la protection des données s'appliquent à différents types d'utilisation de données à caractère personnel, et ce, dans différentes régions du monde. Un exemple important de loi sur la protection des données qui est pertinent pour notre utilisation de vos données personnelles, telle que décrite dans la présente Politique de confidentialité, est le Règlement Général sur la Protection des Données de l'Union européenne (2016/679, RGPD).
La plupart des obligations découlant du RGPD s'appliquent au responsable du traitement. Un responsable du traitement est l'entité qui décide à quelles fins les données à caractère personnel seront traitées et comment le traitement sera effectué. Le responsable du traitement peut faire appel à un sous-traitant de données. Un sous-traitant de données est une entité qui ne peut traiter les données à caractère personnel que selon les instructions du responsable du traitement et ne peut pas utiliser les données à caractère personnel à ses propres fins.
Lorsque nous traitons vos données à caractère personnel, nous assumons le rôle de responsable du traitement tel que décrit dans la présente Politique de confidentialité.

Job Description
At JTI we celebrate differences, and everyone truly belongs. 46,000 people from all over the world are continuously building their unique success story with us. 83% of employees feel happy working at JTI.

To make a difference with us, all you need to do is bring your human best.

What will your story be? Apply now!  

Learn more: jti.com

TOBACCO QUALITY ASSOCIATE

For the new tobacco factory in TETOUAN, we are seeking Quality Associate to monitor production processes, conduct quality inspections, and ensure compliance with safety protocols and JTI standards. This position is based on-site.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

As a Quality Associate, you will be responsible for ensuring the compliance of processes and final products through regular inspections, adhering to the Quality Inspection Plan. You will monitor and check compliance against product specifications, taking necessary corrective actions when requirements are not met.

You will maintain accurate quality inspection data by registering daily test results in the quality database or on hard-copy records as required. This includes calculating daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual averages for test results and preparing and submitting summary reports to your immediate supervisor.

You will inspect material handling and process flows, ensuring all operations follow established procedures. This also includes overseeing brand changeover procedures and demonstrating a strong commitment to health and safety standards.

You will participate in KPI calculations, organize summarized data, and support root cause identification for corrective actions. Additionally, you will be responsible for managing QUIP (Quality Unsure Inspected Products) by holding, segregating, labeling, and inspecting products identified during inspections, as per the established guidelines. You will also help identify the root cause and propose possible solutions for any issues.

You will ensure the proper use and handling of quality measuring instruments (QME), ensuring that equipment is safely utilized and the working area remains clean and organized. Your role will also involve actively participating in system upgrades, ensuring effective implementation, and coaching shop floor operators in adapting to new systems.

Additionally, you will support pest control activities, particularly in managing tobacco beetle, and participate in the implementation of 5S and 3R initiatives to standardize quality laboratories.

EDUCATION

University degree in Chemistry or similar.

WORK EXPERIENCE

2-3 years of work experience in a Manufacturing environment.
competences:
SKILLS

Proficiency in English, French, and Arabic (written and verbal communication)
Strong computer skills with advanced proficiency in MS Office Suite
In-depth knowledge of internal regulatory compliance and procedures
Expertise in safety protocols and maintaining a safe work environment
Solid laboratory skills with experience in quality control processes
Strong understanding of statistical analysis and data interpretation principles
Are you ready to join us? Build your success story at JTI. Apply now!

After applying, if selected, please anticipate the following within 1-3 weeks of the job posting closure: Phone screening with Talent Advisor > Assessment tests > Interviews > Offer. Each step is eliminatory and may vary by role type.

Arrow Enterprise Computing Solutions (ECS), a part of Arrow Electronics, brings innovative IT solutions to market to solve complex business challenges. We deliver value-added distribution, business consulting and channel enablement services to leading technology manufacturers and their channel partners. We help businesses grow faster, operate efficiently and transform in a dynamic market.
Position Summary:


The System Administrator with Access Management Specialization plays a critical role in managing and maintaining the organization's IT infrastructure while ensuring secure and efficient user access to systems, applications, and data. This role is focused on access management processes, identity lifecycle management, and maintaining compliance with security policies.
Key Responsibilities:


System Administration:
1. Infrastructure Management:
o Maintain, upgrade, and troubleshoot servers, storage, and cloud environments (on-premises or cloud-based).
o Perform software and hardware updates for systems, ensuring optimal functionality and security.
o Monitor system health and performance, and ensure high availability and reliability.
2. Security and Compliance:
o Implement security policies and protocols across systems.
o Conduct regular system audits and reviews to ensure compliance with regulatory and organizational standards.
3. Backup and Recovery:
o Develop and maintain backup strategies for critical data and systems.
o Execute disaster recovery plans and troubleshoot system failures as needed.
Access Management:


1. Identity and Access Lifecycle:
o Manage user accounts, roles, and permissions for systems, applications, and databases.
o Onboard/offboard users in accordance with organizational policies and procedures.
o Facilitate provisioning and de-provisioning of system access.
2. Authentication and Authorization:
o Configure and maintain Single Sign-On (SSO), Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), and role-based access controls (RBAC).
o Ensure secure access for internal and external users while minimizing risks.
3. Access Policies:
o Design and implement policies for access control (e.g., least privilege principles).
o Regularly review and update access policies to align with evolving security requirements.
Incident Management:


1. Investigate and respond to access-related security incidents.
2. Resolve access issues promptly, minimizing disruption to users.
Collaboration and Support:


1. Work closely with IT teams, security teams, and business stakeholders to address access requirements and optimize workflows.
2. Provide end-user support for authentication and access-related issues.
3. Deliver training and documentation for users on access protocols and systems.
Requirements:


Education

:
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Experience:


• Proven experience in system administration roles.
• Strong expertise in access management technologies (e.g., Active Directory, Azure AD, IAM systems).
competences:
Skills:


1. Technical Skills:
Proficiency in server operating systems (e.g., Windows Server, Linux).
Knowledge of authentication protocols (e.g., LDAP, Kerberos, OAuth).
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
2. Analytical and Problem-Solving:
o Ability to diagnose and resolve access-related issues quickly and efficiently.
o Capability to analyze access data and identify potential risks.
3. Communication:
o Effective verbal and written communication skills to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
4. Organizational Skills:
o Strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize multiple tasks.
o Familiarity with access management workflows and ticketing systems.

Assurer l’optimisation et le pilotage des parcours clients pour les offres Idar, FTTH et ADSL.

Esprit d'équipe et capacité à motiver les collaborateurs

description:
Description du poste

Notre client, un acteur majeur du secteur assurance, recherche un Consultant Réseaux et Sécurité pour une mission Freelance. Ce rôle clé vise à sécuriser les infrastructures IT, garantir la conformité aux normes sectorielles et accompagner la transformation digitale de l’entreprise.

Mission

En tant qu’expert Réseaux et Sécurité, vous serez responsable de :

Concevoir et sécuriser les architectures réseau :
Auditer et optimiser les infrastructures existantes (LAN, WAN, VPN, cloud hybride).
Déployer des solutions de sécurité (firewalls, IDS/IPS, NAC, Zero Trust) adaptées aux besoins métiers.
Protéger les données sensibles (clients, contrats) via des mécanismes de chiffrement, DLP et IAM.
Garantir la conformité réglementaire :
Appliquer les normes sectorielles (RGPD, Solvabilité II) et frameworks de sécurité (ISO 27001, NIST).
Préparer et accompagner les audits de sécurité internes/externes.
Gérer les incidents et la continuité d’activité :
Mettre en place des plans de réponse aux incidents (PRA/PCA) et des protocoles de résilience.
Analyser les vulnérabilités et proposer des correctifs prioritaires.
Collaborer avec les équipes IT et métiers :
Former les équipes internes aux bonnes pratiques de cybersécurité.
Piloter des projets transverses (migration cloud, modernisation des data centers).
Profil recherché

Formation & Expérience

Diplômé(e) d’une école d’ingénieur (spécialisation réseaux/cybersécurité) ou Master en sécurité informatique.
5 ans d’expérience minimum en conception et sécurisation d’infrastructures réseaux, idéalement dans le secteur assurance, banque ou financier.
Expérience avérée en régie ou conseil auprès de grands comptes.
Compétences techniques

Expertise réseaux :
Protocoles (TCP/IP, BGP, OSPF), virtualisation (SD-WAN, NSX), et outils de monitoring (SolarWinds, Wireshark).
Sécurité : Pare-feux (Palo Alto, Fortinet), solutions de détection d’intrusions (Cisco Firepower), et gestion des identités (Okta, Azure AD).
Cloud : Sécurisation d’environnements hybrides (AWS, Azure) et architectures Zero Trust.
Conformité :
Maîtrise des réglementations sectorielles (RGPD, Solvabilité II, DORA) et normes de sécurité.
Certifications (CISSP, CISM, CEH) un atout.
Soft Skills

Analytique : Capacité à identifier les risques et prioriser les actions.
Pédagogie : Aptitude à vulgariser des enjeux techniques pour des publics non-experts.
Réactivité : Gestion efficace des crises et incidents critiques.
Collaboration : Expérience en travail transversal avec des équipes DevOps, Data et métiers.

titre: PMO Senior Infrastructure IT - Secteur Bancaire en Freelance Ref. 005954
description:
Job Description
Pour le compte de l'un de nos client, nous recherchons un PMO responsable de la mise en place et du suivi des processus de gestion de projets, en collaboration étroite avec les chefs de projet infra, les responsables de domaines et les parties prenantes.

Durée: 6 mois renouvelable 
Démarrage; ASAP
Localisation: Casablanca, Maroc
MISSION:

1. Soutien aux chefs de projet et responsables de domaines :

Accompagner les chefs de projet (CP) dans la planification, l'exécution et le suivi des projets infrastructure.
Aider les CP à élaborer des plans de projet réalistes, en tenant compte des contraintes techniques, budgétaires et des plannings.
Mettre en place un capacity planning pour mieux distribuer la charge de travail en adéquation avec les capacités des équipes.
Faciliter la communication entre les équipes techniques, les CP et les parties prenantes.
2. Accompagnement sur les outils et le reporting :

Accompagner les sachants et les CP dans l'utilisation des outils de gestion de projets et de reporting.
Mettre en place et maintenir des tableaux de bord (dashboards) pour visualiser l'état des projets et du portefeuille.
Assurer la formation et le support sur les outils de suivi.
Consolider les données et produire des rapports réguliers pour les comités de pilotage et le directoire.
3. Gestion des relations avec les différents services :

Collaborer avec le contrôle de gestion pour assurer le suivi budgétaire et financier des projets.
Travailler avec les achats pour gérer les contrats avec les prestataires et les fournisseurs.
Coordonner avec les équipes business delivery pour s'assurer que les projets répondent aux besoins métiers.
Servir de point de contact central entre les différents services et les équipes projets.
4. Suivi budgétaire et financier :

Assurer le suivi des budgets alloués aux projets et identifier les écarts par rapport aux prévisions.
Préparer des rapports financiers réguliers pour les comités de pilotage et les décideurs.
Consolider les flash reports et les rapports d'avancement pour le directoire.
Alerter en cas de dépassements budgétaires et proposer des plans de remédiation.
Suivre l'OPEX (dépenses opérationnelles) et s'assurer du respect des engagements financiers.
5. Mise en place de KPI et tableaux de bord :

Définir et mettre en place des indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) pour mesurer l'avancement des projets.
Concevoir et maintenir des tableaux de bord (dashboards) pour visualiser l'état des projets.
Analyser les données pour identifier les tendances, les risques et les opportunités d'amélioration.
Fournir des rapports réguliers aux parties prenantes pour soutenir la prise de décision.
6. Comitologie et organisation des comités :

Préparer et organiser les comités de pilotage (COPIL), les comités de projet (COPRO) et les réunions avec le directoire.
Rédiger les comptes-rendus et assurer le suivi des décisions prises lors des comités.
Coordonner les présentations et les supports nécessaires pour les réunions.
Assurer la diffusion des informations et des décisions aux équipes concernées.
7. Gestion des risques et des alertes :

Identifier, évaluer et suivre les risques liés aux projets infrastructure.
Mettre en place un système d'alertes pour anticiper les dérives (délais, budgets, qualité).
Proposer des plans d'action pour atténuer les risques et résoudre les problèmes.
Assurer un reporting régulier sur l'état des risques et des actions correctives.
8. Suivi de la feuille de route et des engagements :

Suivre l'exécution de la feuille de route infrastructure et s'assurer du respect des engagements.
Coordonner avec les équipes pour ajuster les plannings en fonction des évolutions et des contraintes.
Assurer le suivi des engagements OPEX et proposer des ajustements si nécessaire.
9. Capacity planning et optimisation des ressources :

Mettre en place un capacity planning pour mieux répartir la charge de travail en fonction des capacités des équipes.
Analyser les données de time tracking pour optimiser l'allocation des ressources.
Identifier les surcharges ou les sous-utilisations de ressources et proposer des ajustements.

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ :

Diplôme de niveau Bac +5 (école de commerce, école d'ingénieur ou université) en gestion de projets, finance ou domaine connexe.
Minimum 8ans dont 5 ans d'expérience en tant que PMO ou dans un rôle similaire, idéalement dans le secteur bancaire et sur des projets infrastructure.
Maîtrise des méthodologies de gestion de projet type : Agile, Scrum, Prince2, Cycle en V.
Connaissance des normes ITIL et des bonnes pratiques de gestion des services IT.
Expérience dans la mise en place de KPI, de tableaux de bord et de systèmes de reporting.
Compréhension des environnements techniques bancaires : virtualisation, réseaux, data center, stockage, sauvegarde, PCA, etc.
Connaissance des architectures techniques et des normes de sécurité informatique.
Maîtrise des outils de gestion de projets (MS Project, Sciforma, etc.) et des outils de reporting (Power BI, Excel, etc.).
Expérience avec les outils de time tracking et de gestion des ressources.
Capacité à suivre et analyser les budgets projets.
Expérience dans la préparation de rapports financiers et l'optimisation des coûts.
Connaissance des concepts OPEX et CAPEX.
Solides compétences en gestion de projets et en suivi budgétaire.
Capacité à travailler en collaboration avec des équipes techniques et métiers.
Excellente communication orale et écrite.
Capacité à analyser des données complexes et à proposer des solutions pragmatiques.
Esprit d'analyse et de synthèse.
Qualités relationnelles et capacité à fédérer les équipes.
Rigueur, organisation et sens de l'anticipation.
Adaptabilité et autonomie.
Orientation client et sens du service.

description:
Job Description
PETIT FORESTIER est le leader de la location de matériel frigorifique en Europe.

Créé en 1907 son histoire familiale lui confère une singularité sur le marché qui lui permet d'afficher des chiffres en progression constante : 940 millions d'euros de Chiffre d'Affaires, 5'100 collaborateurs, 300 sites répartis dans 20 pays.

Au sein du Groupe, Petit Forestier Digital Solutions est le Centre De Services nearshore du groupe Petit Forestier.

Crée en 2017, PFDS accompagne le groupe dans sa transformation digitale en offrant un catalogue de services complet (Support applicatif et infrastructure multi-niveaux, Développement, administration et maintenance des systèmes d'informations groupe, Test et qualité logicielle, BI et Data Quality, Cyber sécurité, Business Process Outsourcing)

Pour cette entité, nous recherchons un " Administrateur Rôles et Autorisations SAP (H/F)".

Contexte :
Le groupe Petit Forestier est en forte croissance, à la fois organique et externe avec des acquisitions à l’international. Dans ce contexte, le groupe a lancé un programme ambitieux de transformation (TOM). Il intègre un volet système d’information majeur avec l’implémentation de la solution SAP pour remplacer le cœur du système d’information existant.

Petit Forestier est accompagné d’une assistance à maîtrise d’ouvrage pour construire un modèle opérationnel cible, ainsi que d’un intégrateur SAP pour construire la solution.

Le périmètre SAP couvre les achats, la finance, les contrats, la facturation, la maintenance et la gestion de flotte.

Quel sera votre rôle ?

Vous êtes l'interlocuteur privilégié/Référant pour l'administration des droits SAP sur différents modules : S/4 HANA (FI-CO, SD, MM), FSM (Fleet System Management), SAP Concur

Activités principales :

Définition et maintien de la matrice des rôles et autorisations selon les évolutions des processus métiers en collaboration avec les responsables fonctionnels et experts SAP
Conception, mise en œuvre et évolution des profils utilisateur.
Gestion des rôles simples, dérivés et composites.
Garantir la conformité et le respect des normes
Suivre l'application des notes SAP sécurité en lien avec les autorisations et les outils SAP
Auditer et optimiser les règles liées aux paramètres de sécurité SAP
Mise en place des tests d'intrusion et des contrôles de vulnérabilités du code
Suivi de la sécurisation des bases HANA en termes de gestion des droits et contrôles d’actions sensibles
Assistance aux utilisateurs pour les questions relatives aux autorisations.
Profil et qualifications :

De formation supérieure Bac+5 en informatique
Vous avez une expérience d’au moins 4 ans dans la gestion des autorisations SAP
Connaissances approfondies des aspects liés à la sécurité (confidentialité, sécurisation des systèmes et administration des rôles) et autres solutions de type SIEM et IAM
Compétences techniques et développements selon les technologies (ex ECC, Solutions Manager, dv HANA, Fiori, S4 et BW4HANA)
Être flexible, organisé et méthodique
Capacité de travailler en autonomie et en équipe
Bonne communication orale et écrite en Français. L’anglais est souhaitable

Job Description
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

THE SAP YOUNG PROFESSIONALS PROGRAM

The SAP Young Professionals Program is a free initiative delivered by the Digital Skills Center of SAP. The program, which lasts for 2 months, is designed to give recent graduates the certifications and soft skills required to begin a career as an SAP Associate Consultant. At the end of the training, SAP will work very closely with the program graduates to introduce them to a host of opportunities with SAP customers and partners to work as an SAP Consultant.

SAP CONSULTANTS

The role of an SAP Consultant can be divided into 2 functions: Functional and Technical.

The consultant will contribute to blueprinting, design, implementation, operation, optimization, and upgrade phase of a S/4 HANA project, and provide business process as well as functional expertise, and project guidance to our clients to ensure their investment in SAP software and consulting services will make their business the best run business.

The Consultant is also responsible for maintaining a high degree of customer satisfaction in each of their accounts in addition to growing and developing referenceable customers through their investigation, analysis, consulting, coaching, knowledge transfer, and relationship-building efforts.

CERTIFICATE INFORMATION:

SAP S/4HANA Cloud is a complete enterprise resource planning (ERP) system with built-in intelligent technologies, including AI, machine learning, and advanced analytics. It helps companies adopt new business models, manage business change at speed, orchestrate internal and external resources, and use the predictive power of AI. Benefit from tight, native integration between processes, industry depth, and a consistent in-memory data model. 

HOW YOU BENEFIT:

Start your journey to become an SAP Consultant;
Gain globally-recognised associate-level SAP Certifications;
Learn directly from SAP experts;
Experience classroom and workshop-based training in SAP Technologies;
Develop the soft skills needed to prepare you for successful job applications;
Benefit from introductions to job opportunities within the SAP Ecosystem to help secure a position after the training. Please note this program does not guarantee you a job at the end of it.
WHAT WE REQUIRE FROM A CANDIDATE:

Candidates must have the legal right to work in Ivory Coast.
Candidates must be currently unemployed or employed in a part time/non-permanent role not related to career aspirations;
Candidates must be educated to at least Bachelor level in a field related to Business Administration / Management Information Systems / Engineering / Data Science
Candidates will preferably have graduated within the last 3 years with a GPA in the top quartile – proof of this may be requested.
Candidates must have a keen interest in starting an SAP-related career involving travel;
Candidates should be fluent in English, both written and spoken;
The program will commence by mid-May 2025and full-time availability from 9am – 6pm from Monday - Friday throughout the training period is essential. The Program will last for 2 months.
This training will take place online in a virtual live classroom format. Please ensure you have strong enough internet at home to be able to participate in this program.
Please share an English version of your resume while applying for this program.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT 
 
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy.

The AI Automation Specialist (IT Support) is responsible for analyzing operational workflows, and service delivery processes within IT Support and Managed Services. This role identifies opportunities for automation, workflow improvements, and knowledge management enhancements. Automation & AI Implementation

Cross-Team Collaboration & Change Management

Education & Experience

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business Process Management, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

3+ years of experience in service operations, IT support, automation, or process improvement roles.

Experience with IT Service Management (ITSM) tools such as ServiceNow, Zendesk, or Jira Service Management.


Technical & Analytical Skills

Strong understanding of workflow automation, AI-driven support tools, and process optimization methodologies.

Familiarity with automation tools such as Robotic Process Automation (RPA), chatbot platforms, or AI-driven service solutions.

Ability to analyze and interpret data to drive process improvement recommendations.

Soft Skills & Collaboration

Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Problem-solving mindset with a focus on efficiency and user experience.

Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with AI/ML applications in customer support or managed services.

Job Description
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

THE SAP YOUNG PROFESSIONALS PROGRAM

The SAP Young Professionals Program is a free initiative delivered by the Digital Skills Center of SAP. The program, which lasts for 2 months, is designed to give recent graduates the certifications and soft skills required to begin a career as an SAP Associate Consultant. At the end of the training, SAP will work very closely with the program graduates to introduce them to a host of opportunities with SAP customers and partners to work as an SAP Consultant.

SAP CONSULTANTS

The role of an SAP Consultant can be divided into 2 functions: Functional and Technical.

The consultant will contribute to blueprinting, design, implementation, operation, optimization, and upgrade phase of a S/4 HANA project, and provide business process as well as functional expertise, and project guidance to our clients to ensure their investment in SAP software and consulting services will make their business the best run business.

The Consultant is also responsible for maintaining a high degree of customer satisfaction in each of their accounts in addition to growing and developing referenceable customers through their investigation, analysis, consulting, coaching, knowledge transfer, and relationship-building efforts.

CERTIFICATE INFORMATION:

SAP S/4HANA Cloud is a complete enterprise resource planning (ERP) system with built-in intelligent technologies, including AI, machine learning, and advanced analytics. It helps companies adopt new business models, manage business change at speed, orchestrate internal and external resources, and use the predictive power of AI. Benefit from tight, native integration between processes, industry depth, and a consistent in-memory data model. 

HOW YOU BENEFIT:

Start your journey to become an SAP Consultant;
Gain globally-recognised associate-level SAP Certifications;
Learn directly from SAP experts;
Experience classroom and workshop-based training in SAP Technologies;
Develop the soft skills needed to prepare you for successful job applications;
Benefit from introductions to job opportunities within the SAP Ecosystem to help secure a position after the training. Please note this program does not guarantee you a job at the end of it.
WHAT WE REQUIRE FROM A CANDIDATE:

Candidates must have the legal right to work in Tunisia.
Candidates must be currently unemployed or employed in a part time/non-permanent role not related to career aspirations;
Candidates must be educated to at least Bachelor level in a field related to Business Administration / Management Information Systems / Engineering / Data Science
Candidates will preferably have graduated within the last 3 years with a GPA in the top quartile – proof of this may be requested.
Candidates must have a keen interest in starting an SAP-related career involving travel;
Candidates should be fluent in English, both written and spoken;
The program will commence by mid-May 2025and full-time availability from 9am – 6pm from Monday - Friday throughout the training period is essential. The Program will last for 2 months.
This training will take place online in a virtual live classroom format. Please ensure you have strong enough internet at home to be able to participate in this program.
Please share an English version of your resume while applying for this program.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT 
 
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy.
